Description: Floor and stem sherd of Attic (or South Ionian?) pottery cup; wholly glazed; short stem with slight step at junction of stem and foot with scraped groove below and another irregular scraped groove above; inscription on interior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), temenos (said to be)
Curator's comments: Compare Sparkes and Talcott 1970, nos 404-420 (500-480BC). Clay is not clearly Attic, though the shape is not that of stemmed East Greek cups. Cups type C are attested before 510BC in destruction levels at Sybaris, see E. Greco, 'Sullo σχῆμα di Thurii: venti anni di ricerche con Silvana Luppino', Annuario della Scuola archeologica di Atene e delle Missioni italiane in Oriente XCII (Serie III, 14) (2014) [2016], 1-11, esp. 5.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.829)
